alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 11:41AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR AREAS NEAR FORT VALLEY AND AREAS TOWARD THE BASE OF THE ARIZONA SNOWBOWL... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...The community of Fort Valley in Coconino County. * WHEN...Until 145 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Flooding over low-water crossings. Ponding of water on interstates, highways and in urban areas will create hazardous travel conditions. Water flowing over roadways will create slick paved roads and muddy unpaved roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1139 AM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Volunteer Wash and Deadman Wash. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Valley and Arizona Snowbowl. - This includes the following highways... Highway 180 between mile markers 222 and 231. Interstate 40 between mile markers 184 and 191. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding of washes and creeks will occur, some dirt roads will become muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses could become flooded as well.
